util

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    A series of public static methods that are written to provide utility to other classes
    Author:
    Calvin

    • Method Detail

      • interpolateColors

        public static java.awt.Color interpolateColors(java.awt.Color color1,
                                               java.awt.Color color2,
                                               double stepCount,
                                               double totalSteps)
        Will return a color evenly interpolated between two others assuming one is stepCount between them out of totalSteps. This method uses linear interpolation
        Parameters:
        color1 - the first color. If stepCount was 0, this color would be returned.
        color2 - the second color. If stepCount equaled totalSteps, this color would be returned.
        stepCount - the amount of steps one is between the two colors
        totalSteps - the total amount of steps between the two colors
        Returns:
        a new color which is the result of interpolating the two colors

      • interpolateColors

        public static java.awt.Color interpolateColors(java.awt.Color color1,
                                               java.awt.Color color2,
                                               double fraction)
        Will return a color evenly interpolated between the two assuming one is fraction% of the way between them. This method uses linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        color1 - the first color. if fraction is 0, this color will be returned.
        color2 - the second color. if fraction is 1, this color will be returned.
        fraction - the percent of the way between the two colors where interpolation needs to take place
        Returns:
        a new Color which is the result of interpolating the two colors

      • convertColortoFX

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color convertColortoFX(java.awt.Color color)
        Used to convert java.awt Color to a JavaFX color
        Parameters:
        c - the java.awt color
        Returns:
        a new JafaFX color

      • convertColortoAWT

        public static java.awt.Color convertColortoAWT(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Used to convert a JavaFX color to a java.awt color
        Parameters:
        color - the JavaFX color
        Returns:
        the java.awt color

      • interpolateDouble

        public static java.lang.Double interpolateDouble(java.lang.Double d1,
                                                 java.lang.Double d2,
                                                 int stepCount,
                                                 int totalSteps)
        Interpolates two doubles using linear interpolation assuming one is (stepCount / totalSteps)% between the two colors
        Parameters:
        d1 - the first number. if stepCount is 0, this number will be returned.
        d2 - the second number. If stepCount equals totalSteps, this number will be returned.
        stepCount - the amount of steps one is between the two colors
        totalSteps - the total amount of steps between the two colors
        Returns:
        a double which is the result of linearly interpolating the two doubles

      • getBroadcastAddress

        public static java.net.InetAddress getBroadcastAddress()
        This method finds and returns the broadcast InetAddress of the specific router being accessed
        Returns:
        the broadcast InetAddress of the specific router being accessed

      • mergeSort

        public static double[][] mergeSort(double[][] array)
        This method doesn't really belong in this class because it is used only by the HistogramLayer class. Also, now that I know I can just call List.sort(new Comparator...); I would not write this again. Anyways, this method applies merge sort to a 2D array of doubles, sorting them based on a specific value of one element of the grid.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be sorted
        Returns:
        the sorted array
